Instruction: Cook couscous according to package instructions using water. Fluff with a fork and let it cool to room temperature.
In a large bowl, combine the cooked couscous, sweet cherries, sliced almonds, chopped parsley, and diced red onion.
In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, honey, salt, and black pepper to make the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the couscous salad and toss gently to combine all ingredients evenly.
Refrigerate the salad for at least 30 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld.
Serve the cherry almond couscous salad chilled as a refreshing side dish.
